techmeme.title: Charlotte, NC-based Aiwyn, which provides automation software for accounting firms, raised $113M led by KKR and Bessemer, bringing its total funding to $127M (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
YouTube plans to start a crackdown on "egregious clickbait", or videos where the titles or thumbnails make claims the videos don't back up, beginning in India (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
A look at Frank McCourt's efforts to acquire TikTok and the obstacles he faces, as he lobbies Congress and Trump's team and recruits former TikTok executives (Bloomberg)
Backflip, which is building AI models that can generate 3D designs using text, sketches, or photos as prompts, raised a $30M Series A co-led by NEA and a16z (Charles Rollet/TechCrunch)
Anthropic, whose CEO, Dario Amodei, has vocally opposed Donald Trump, and OpenAI look to hire more people with ties to Trump and the GOP for their policy teams (Stephanie Palazzolo/The Information)
